Branch: feature/segment-extraction

# Video Segment Extraction Implementation

Created: 2025-01-26
Status: active
Last updated: 2025-01-26
Type: feature

## Overview
Implement video segment extraction functionality using FFmpeg with stream copy for fast extraction. The feature will support single segment extraction, rating-based extraction, and manual selection of multiple segments. Later optimization will implement smart lossless extraction using I-frame analysis.

## Progress
- Overall: 8/24 tasks (33%)
- Phase 1: 7/7 tasks (complete)
- Phase 2: 1/5 tasks  
- Phase 3: 0/5 tasks
- Phase 4: 0/4 tasks
- Phase 5: 0/3 tasks

## Phase 1: Core FFmpeg Integration & Infrastructure

- [x] Install and configure FFmpeg dependency [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: Package.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add FFmpeg as dependency or document installation requirement

- [x] Create FFmpegManager class for video operations [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Implement Process wrapper for FFmpeg commands
  - Add stream copy extraction method

- [x] Implement segment time calculation utilities [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/CMTime+Segment.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Convert between CMTime and FFmpeg time format
  - Calculate frame-accurate end time (marker frame - 1)

- [x] Create SegmentExtractionManager [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Single segment extraction using FFmpegManager
  - Progress tracking with Combine publishers

- [x] Implement extraction result models [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionResult.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success/failure states with error details
  - Output file path and metadata

- [x] Add file naming and output directory logic [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/ExtractionFileManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Generate unique filenames with segment info
  - Handle output directory selection

- [x] Create extraction error handling [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionError.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - FFmpeg error parsing
  - User-friendly error messages

## Phase 2: Extraction Modal UI

- [x] Create ExtractionModalView with tabs [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Use existing modal base design
  - Tab view for different extraction types
  - Default to single segment tab

- [ ] Implement SingleSegmentExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/SingleSegmentExtractionView.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Show current segment info (start/end times)
  - Extract button with loading state
  - Display segment duration and marker labels

- [ ] Create extraction progress view [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionProgressView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Progress bar with percentage
  - Cancel button functionality
  - Time remaining estimate

- [ ] Add extraction completion feedback [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success message with file location
  - Open in Finder button
  - Error display for failures

- [ ] Implement keyboard shortcuts for extraction modal [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - ESC to close, Enter to extract
  - Tab navigation between extraction types

## Phase 3: Rating-Based & Multi-Select Extraction

- [ ] Create RatingBasedExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/RatingBasedExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Rating threshold picker (1-5 stars)
  - Preview of segments to extract
  - Batch extraction controls

- [ ] Implement MultiSelectExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/MultiSelectExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Segment list with checkboxes
  - Select all/none buttons
  - Show segment details (duration, rating)

- [ ] Add batch extraction support to SegmentExtractionManager [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Queue multiple extractions
  - Aggregate progress tracking
  - Cancellation of batch operations

- [ ] Create segment filtering logic [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/Array+Segment.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Filter by rating threshold
  - Get segments from marker pairs
  - Validate segment boundaries

- [ ] Implement batch result summary [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/BatchExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - Show success/failure count
  - List of extracted files
  - Total time and size saved

## Phase 4: Integration & Menu Items

- [ ] Add extraction menu items to main menu [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/App/SwiftMediaApp.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Extract Current Segment menu item
  - Extract Multiple Segments submenu
  - Keyboard shortcut assignments

- [ ] Connect VideoPlayerViewModel to extraction [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/ViewModels/VideoPlayerViewModel.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add extraction modal presentation
  - Pass current segment info
  - Handle extraction completion

- [ ] Add extraction state to ProjectManager [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Project/ProjectManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Track extraction history
  - Save output directory preference
  - Recent extractions list

- [ ] Implement extraction keyboard shortcuts [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Keyboard/ShortcutRegistry.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Add extraction shortcuts to registry
  - Default: Cmd+E for current segment
  - Make customizable

## Phase 5: Lossless Extraction Optimization

- [ ] Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Use ffprobe to find I-frame positions
  - Calculate optimal cut points
  - Return frame-accurate boundaries

- [ ] Create smart extraction with re-encoding [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SmartExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Stream copy between I-frames
  - Re-encode head/tail segments
  - Concatenate final output

- [ ] Add lossless option to UI [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionSettingsView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create smart extraction with re-encoding"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Toggle for lossless mode
  - Warning about longer processing
  - Quality comparison info

## Additional Metadata

### File Impact Analysis
**New files**: 
- Managers: FFmpegManager, SegmentExtractionManager, ExtractionFileManager, SmartExtractionManager
- Views: ExtractionModalView, SingleSegmentExtractionView, RatingBasedExtractionView, MultiSelectExtractionView, ExtractionProgressView, ExtractionResultView, BatchExtractionResultView, ExtractionSettingsView
- Models: ExtractionResult, ExtractionError
- Extensions: CMTime+Segment, Array+Segment

**Modified files**:
- Package.swift (FFmpeg dependency)
- SwiftMediaApp.swift (menu items)
- VideoPlayerViewModel.swift (extraction integration)
- ProjectManager.swift (extraction state)
- ShortcutRegistry.swift (shortcuts)

### Risk Assessment
**Technical risks**: 
- FFmpeg installation/bundling complexity
- Frame-accurate cutting edge cases
- Large file processing performance

**Timeline risks**: 
- I-frame detection complexity might take longer
- FFmpeg dependency management

**Integration risks**: 
- Ensuring frame accuracy with existing marker system
- Memory usage with large videos

### Success Criteria
- [ ] Single segment extraction works with frame accuracy
- [ ] Stream copy completes in <5 seconds for typical segments
- [ ] Rating-based extraction filters correctly
- [ ] Multi-select UI is intuitive and responsive
- [ ] Lossless extraction produces no visible artifacts
- [ ] All extraction types handle errors gracefully
- [ ] Progress feedback is accurate and cancellable

content.text: I see that SingleSegmentExtractionView.swift already exists! Let me read it first before modifying it:
Now I need to update this view to include the extraction functionality with background processing. Let me check what Segment model looks like:

content.content:
1â†’//
     2â†’//  Segment.swift
     3â†’//  SwiftMedia
     4â†’//
     5â†’//  Created by Ojash Neopane on 6/24/25.
     6â†’//
     7â†’
     8â†’import Foundation
     9â†’import AVFoundation
    10â†’
    11â†’struct Segment: Identifiable {
    12â†’    let id: UUID
    13â†’    let startMarker: Marker?
    14â†’    let endMarker: Marker?
    15â†’
    16â†’    var duration: CMTime {
    17â†’        let startTime = startMarker?.timestamp ?? .zero
    18â†’        let endTime = endMarker?.timestamp ?? .positiveInfinity
    19â†’
    20â†’        if endTime == .positiveInfinity {
    21â†’            return .positiveInfinity
    22â†’        }
    23â†’
    24â†’        return CMTimeSubtract(endTime, startTime)
    25â†’    }
    26â†’
    27â†’    var averageRating: Double {
    28â†’        // Segment rating is determined by the marker at the start of the segment
    29â†’        if let startRating = startMarker?.rating {
    30â†’            return Double(startRating)
    31â†’        }
    32â†’        // Default rating for segments with no start marker (beginning of video)
    33â†’        return 3.0
    34â†’    }
    35â†’
    36â†’    init(id: UUID = UUID(), startMarker: Marker? = nil, endMarker: Marker? = nil) {
    37â†’        self.id = id
    38â†’        self.startMarker = startMarker
    39â†’        self.endMarker = endMarker
    40â†’    }
    41â†’}

content.text: Now let me check the SegmentExtractionManager to see what methods are available:

content.content:
1â†’//
     2â†’//  SegmentExtractionManager.swift
     3â†’//  SwiftMedia
     4â†’//
     5â†’//  Created on 1/26/25.
     6â†’//
     7â†’
     8â†’import Foundation
     9â†’import Combine
    10â†’import AVFoundation
    11â†’
    12â†’/// Manages video segment extraction operations
    13â†’class SegmentExtractionManager: ObservableObject {
    14â†’    
    15â†’    // MARK: - Types
    16â†’    
    17â†’    enum ExtractionError: LocalizedError {
    18â†’        case invalidSegment
    19â†’        case noVideoPath
    20â†’        case outputDirectoryNotSet
    21â†’        case extractionFailed(String)
    22â†’        case cancelled
    23â†’        
    24â†’        var errorDescription: String? {
    25â†’            switch self {
    26â†’            case .invalidSegment:
    27â†’                return "Invalid segment: missing start or end time"
    28â†’            case .noVideoPath:
    29â†’                return "No video file path available"
    30â†’            case .outputDirectoryNotSet:
    31â†’                return "Please select an output directory"
    32â†’            case .extractionFailed(let message):
    33â†’                return "Extraction failed: \(message)"
    34â†’            case .cancelled:
    35â†’                return "Extraction was cancelled"
    36â†’            }
    37â†’        }
    38â†’    }
    39â†’    
    40â†’    struct ExtractionTask: Identifiable {
    41â†’        let id = UUID()
    42â†’        let segment: Segment
    43â†’        let outputPath: String
    44â†’        var status: ExtractionStatus = .pending
    45â†’        var progress: Double = 0.0
    46â†’        var error: Error?
    47â†’    }
    48â†’    
    49â†’    enum ExtractionStatus {
    50â†’        case pending
    51â†’        case inProgress
    52â†’        case completed
    53â†’        case failed
    54â†’        case cancelled
    55â†’    }
    56â†’    
    57â†’    // MARK: - Properties
    58â†’    
    59â†’    @Published var isExtracting = false
    60â†’    @Published var currentProgress: Double = 0.0
    61â†’    @Published var currentTask: ExtractionTask?
    62â†’    @Published var extractionQueue: [ExtractionTask] = []
    63â†’    @Published var completedExtractions: [ExtractionTask] = []
    64â†’    @Published var outputDirectory: URL?
    65â†’    
    66â†’    private let ffmpegManager = FFmpegManager()
    67â†’    private var cancellables = Set<AnyCancellable>()
    68â†’    private var extractionWorkItem: DispatchWorkItem?
    69â†’    
    70â†’    // Progress tracking
    71â†’    private let progressSubject = PassthroughSubject<Double, Never>()
    72â†’    var progressPublisher: AnyPublisher<Double, Never> {
    73â†’        progressSubject.eraseToAnyPublisher()
    74â†’    }
    75â†’    
    76â†’    // MARK: - Initialization
    77â†’    
    78â†’    init() {
    79â†’        setupProgressTracking()
    80â†’        loadOutputDirectory()
    81â†’    }
    82â†’    
    83â†’    // MARK: - Public Methods
    84â†’    
    85â†’    /// Extract a single segment from the video
    86â†’    /// - Parameters:
    87â†’    ///   - segment: The segment to extract
    88â†’    ///   - videoPath: Path to the source video
    89â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate of the video
    90â†’    /// - Returns: Result with the output file path or error
    91â†’    @MainActor
    92â†’    func extractSegment(
    93â†’        _ segment: Segment,
    94â†’        from videoPath: String,
    95â†’        fps: Double
    96â†’    ) async -> Result<String, ExtractionError> {
    97â†’        
    98â†’        // Validate segment
    99â†’        guard let startTime = segment.startMarker?.timestamp,
   100â†’              let endTime = segment.endMarker?.timestamp,
   101â†’              startTime.isValidSegmentTime,
   102â†’              endTime.isValidSegmentTime else {
   103â†’            return .failure(.invalidSegment)
   104â†’        }
   105â†’        
   106â†’        // Check output directory
   107â†’        guard let outputDir = outputDirectory else {
   108â†’            return .failure(.outputDirectoryNotSet)
   109â†’        }
   110â†’        
   111â†’        // Generate output filename
   112â†’        let outputPath = generateOutputPath(
   113â†’            for: segment,
   114â†’            videoPath: videoPath,
   115â†’            outputDirectory: outputDir
   116â†’        )
   117â†’        
   118â†’        // Create extraction task
   119â†’        var task = ExtractionTask(segment: segment, outputPath: outputPath)
   120â†’        task.status = .inProgress
   121â†’        
   122â†’        await MainActor.run {
   123â†’            self.currentTask = task
   124â†’            self.isExtracting = true
   125â†’            self.currentProgress = 0.0
   126â†’        }
   127â†’        
   128â†’        // Calculate segment duration
   129â†’        let duration = startTime.segmentDuration(to: endTime, fps: fps)
   130â†’        let startSeconds = CMTimeGetSeconds(startTime)
   131â†’        let durationSeconds = CMTimeGetSeconds(duration)
   132â†’        
   133â†’        // Perform extraction
   134â†’        let result = await ffmpegManager.extractSegment(
   135â†’            from: videoPath,
   136â†’            to: outputPath,
   137â†’            startTime: startSeconds,
   138â†’            duration: durationSeconds
   139â†’        )
   140â†’        
   141â†’        // Update task status
   142â†’        switch result {
   143â†’        case .success:
   144â†’            task.status = .completed
   145â†’            await MainActor.run {
   146â†’                self.completedExtractions.append(task)
   147â†’                self.currentTask = nil
   148â†’                self.isExtracting = false
   149â†’                self.currentProgress = 100.0
   150â†’            }
   151â†’            return .success(outputPath)
   152â†’            
   153â†’        case .failure(let error):
   154â†’            task.status = .failed
   155â†’            task.error = error
   156â†’            await MainActor.run {
   157â†’                self.currentTask = nil
   158â†’                self.isExtracting = false
   159â†’                self.currentProgress = 0.0
   160â†’            }
   161â†’            return .failure(.extractionFailed(error.localizedDescription))
   162â†’        }
   163â†’    }
   164â†’    
   165â†’    /// Extract multiple segments in batch
   166â†’    /// - Parameters:
   167â†’    ///   - segments: Array of segments to extract
   168â†’    ///   - videoPath: Path to the source video
   169â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate of the video
   170â†’    /// - Returns: Array of results for each extraction
   171â†’    @MainActor
   172â†’    func extractSegments(
   173â†’        _ segments: [Segment],
   174â†’        from videoPath: String,
   175â†’        fps: Double
   176â†’    ) async -> [(segment: Segment, result: Result<String, ExtractionError>)] {
   177â†’        
   178â†’        var results: [(Segment, Result<String, ExtractionError>)] = []
   179â†’        
   180â†’        // Create tasks for all segments
   181â†’        let tasks = segments.compactMap { segment -> ExtractionTask? in
   182â†’            guard let outputDir = outputDirectory else { return nil }
   183â†’            
   184â†’            let outputPath = generateOutputPath(
   185â†’                for: segment,
   186â†’                videoPath: videoPath,
   187â†’                outputDirectory: outputDir
   188â†’            )
   189â†’            
   190â†’            return ExtractionTask(segment: segment, outputPath: outputPath)
   191â†’        }
   192â†’        
   193â†’        extractionQueue = tasks
   194â†’        
   195â†’        // Process each segment
   196â†’        for (index, task) in tasks.enumerated() {
   197â†’            // Check for cancellation
   198â†’            if extractionWorkItem?.isCancelled == true {
   199â†’                let cancelResult = (task.segment, Result<String, ExtractionError>.failure(.cancelled))
   200â†’                results.append(cancelResult)
   201â†’                continue
   202â†’            }
   203â†’            
   204â†’            // Update progress
   205â†’            let overallProgress = Double(index) / Double(tasks.count) * 100
   206â†’            await MainActor.run {
   207â†’                self.currentProgress = overallProgress
   208â†’            }
   209â†’            
   210â†’            // Extract segment
   211â†’            let result = await extractSegment(task.segment, from: videoPath, fps: fps)
   212â†’            results.append((task.segment, result))
   213â†’        }
   214â†’        
   215â†’        // Clear queue
   216â†’        await MainActor.run {
   217â†’            self.extractionQueue.removeAll()
   218â†’            self.currentProgress = 100.0
   219â†’        }
   220â†’        
   221â†’        return results
   222â†’    }
   223â†’    
   224â†’    /// Cancel ongoing extraction
   225â†’    func cancelExtraction() {
   226â†’        ffmpegManager.cancelExtraction()
   227â†’        extractionWorkItem?.cancel()
   228â†’        
   229â†’        if var task = currentTask {
   230â†’            task.status = .cancelled
   231â†’            currentTask = task
   232â†’        }
   233â†’        
   234â†’        isExtracting = false
   235â†’        currentProgress = 0.0
   236â†’    }
   237â†’    
   238â†’    /// Set the output directory for extracted segments
   239â†’    func setOutputDirectory(_ url: URL) {
   240â†’        outputDirectory = url
   241â†’        saveOutputDirectory()
   242â†’    }
   243â†’    
   244â†’    /// Get segments filtered by minimum rating
   245â†’    func getSegmentsByRating(from segments: [Segment], minimumRating: Int) -> [Segment] {
   246â†’        segments.filter { segment in
   247â†’            segment.averageRating >= Double(minimumRating)
   248â†’        }
   249â†’    }
   250â†’    
   251â†’    // MARK: - Private Methods
   252â†’    
   253â†’    private func setupProgressTracking() {
   254â†’        // Subscribe to FFmpeg progress updates
   255â†’        ffmpegManager.progressPublisher
   256â†’            .receive(on: DispatchQueue.main)
   257â†’            .sink { [weak self] progress in
   258â†’                self?.currentProgress = progress.percentage
   259â†’                self?.progressSubject.send(progress.percentage)
   260â†’            }
   261â†’            .store(in: &cancellables)
   262â†’    }
   263â†’    
   264â†’    private func generateOutputPath(
   265â†’        for segment: Segment,
   266â†’        videoPath: String,
   267â†’        outputDirectory: URL
   268â†’    ) -> String {
   269â†’        let videoURL = URL(fileURLWithPath: videoPath)
   270â†’        let baseName = videoURL.deletingPathExtension().lastPathComponent
   271â†’        let fileExtension = videoURL.pathExtension
   272â†’        
   273â†’        // Create descriptive filename
   274â†’        var filename = "\(baseName)_segment"
   275â†’        
   276â†’        // Add time range
   277â†’        if let startTime = segment.startMarker?.timestamp,
   278â†’           let endTime = segment.endMarker?.timestamp {
   279â†’            let startId = startTime.segmentIdentifier
   280â†’            let endId = endTime.segmentIdentifier
   281â†’            filename += "_\(startId)-\(endId)"
   282â†’        }
   283â†’        
   284â†’        // Add rating if available
   285â†’        if let rating = segment.startMarker?.rating {
   286â†’            filename += "_\(rating)star"
   287â†’        }
   288â†’        
   289â†’        // Add first label if available
   290â†’        if let label = segment.startMarker?.labels.first {
   291â†’            let sanitizedLabel = label
   292â†’                .replacingOccurrences(of: " ", with: "_")
   293â†’                .replacingOccurrences(of: "/", with: "-")
   294â†’            filename += "_\(sanitizedLabel)"
   295â†’        }
   296â†’        
   297â†’        filename += ".\(fileExtension)"
   298â†’        
   299â†’        return outputDirectory.appendingPathComponent(filename).path
   300â†’    }
   301â†’    
   302â†’    // MARK: - Persistence
   303â†’    
   304â†’    private func loadOutputDirectory() {
   305â†’        if let bookmarkData = UserDefaults.standard.data(forKey: "SegmentExtractionOutputDirectory") {
   306â†’            var isStale = false
   307â†’            if let url = try? URL(resolvingBookmarkData: bookmarkData, options: [], relativeTo: nil, bookmarkDataIsStale: &isStale) {
   308â†’                outputDirectory = url
   309â†’            }
   310â†’        }
   311â†’    }
   312â†’    
   313â†’    private func saveOutputDirectory() {
   314â†’        guard let outputDirectory = outputDirectory,
   315â†’              let bookmarkData = try? outputDirectory.bookmarkData() else { return }
   316â†’        
   317â†’        UserDefaults.standard.set(bookmarkData, forKey: "SegmentExtractionOutputDirectory")
   318â†’    }
   319â†’}
   320â†’
   321â†’// MARK: - Convenience Extensions
   322â†’
   323â†’extension SegmentExtractionManager {
   324â†’    
   325â†’    /// Extract the current segment based on playhead position
   326â†’    /// - Parameters:
   327â†’    ///   - currentTime: Current playhead time
   328â†’    ///   - markers: All markers in the video
   329â†’    ///   - videoPath: Path to the video
   330â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate
   331â†’    /// - Returns: Result with output path or error
   332â†’    @MainActor
   333â†’    func extractCurrentSegment(
   334â†’        at currentTime: CMTime,
   335â†’        markers: [Marker],
   336â†’        videoPath: String,
   337â†’        fps: Double
   338â†’    ) async -> Result<String, ExtractionError> {
   339â†’        
   340â†’        // Find the segment containing the current time
   341â†’        guard let segment = findSegment(at: currentTime, from: markers) else {
   342â†’            return .failure(.invalidSegment)
   343â†’        }
   344â†’        
   345â†’        return await extractSegment(segment, from: videoPath, fps: fps)
   346â†’    }
   347â†’    
   348â†’    private func findSegment(at time: CMTime, from markers: [Marker]) -> Segment? {
   349â†’        let sortedMarkers = markers.sorted { $0.timestamp < $1.timestamp }
   350â†’        
   351â†’        // Find markers before and after the current time
   352â†’        var startMarker: Marker?
   353â†’        var endMarker: Marker?
   354â†’        
   355â†’        for i in 0..<sortedMarkers.count {
   356â†’            if sortedMarkers[i].timestamp <= time {
   357â†’                startMarker = sortedMarkers[i]
   358â†’            } else {
   359â†’                endMarker = sortedMarkers[i]
   360â†’                break
   361â†’            }
   362â†’        }
   363â†’        
   364â†’        // Handle edge cases
   365â†’        if startMarker == nil && !sortedMarkers.isEmpty {
   366â†’            // Current time is before first marker
   367â†’            endMarker = sortedMarkers.first
   368â†’        }
   369â†’        
   370â†’        return Segment(startMarker: startMarker, endMarker: endMarker)
   371â†’    }
   372â†’}

     2â†’//  CMTime+Segment.swift

     8â†’import Foundation
     9â†’import AVFoundation
    10â†’
    11â†’extension CMTime {
    12â†’    
    13â†’    // MARK: - FFmpeg Time Format
    14â†’    
    15â†’    /// Convert CMTime to FFmpeg time format (HH:MM:SS.mmm)
    16â†’    /// - Returns: Time string formatted for FFmpeg
    17â†’    func toFFmpegFormat() -> String {
    18â†’        let seconds = CMTimeGetSeconds(self)
    19â†’        guard seconds.isFinite && seconds >= 0 else {
    20â†’            return "00:00:00.000"
    21â†’        }
    22â†’        
    23â†’        let hours = Int(seconds) / 3600
    24â†’        let minutes = (Int(seconds) % 3600) / 60
    25â†’        let secs = seconds.truncatingRemainder(dividingBy: 60)
    26â†’        
    27â†’        return String(format: "%02d:%02d:%06.3f", hours, minutes, secs)
    28â†’    }
    29â†’    
    30â†’    /// Create CMTime from FFmpeg time format string
    31â†’    /// - Parameter timeString: Time in format HH:MM:SS.mmm
    32â†’    /// - Returns: CMTime or nil if invalid format
    33â†’    static func fromFFmpegFormat(_ timeString: String) -> CMTime? {
    34â†’        let components = timeString.split(separator: ":")
    35â†’        guard components.count == 3,
    36â†’              let hours = Double(components[0]),
    37â†’              let minutes = Double(components[1]),
    38â†’              let seconds = Double(components[2]) else {
    39â†’            return nil
    40â†’        }
    41â†’        
    42â†’        let totalSeconds = hours * 3600 + minutes * 60 + seconds
    43â†’        return CMTime(seconds: totalSeconds, preferredTimescale: 600)
    44â†’    }
    45â†’    
    46â†’    // MARK: - Segment Calculations
    47â†’    
    48â†’    /// Calculate the frame-accurate end time for a segment
    49â†’    /// The end time should be one frame before the next marker
    50â†’    /// - Parameters:
    51â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate of the video
    52â†’    /// - Returns: Adjusted end time
    53â†’    func segmentEndTime(fps: Double) -> CMTime {
    54â†’        guard fps > 0 else { return self }
    55â†’        
    56â†’        let frameDuration = CMTime(seconds: 1.0 / fps, preferredTimescale: self.timescale)
    57â†’        return self - frameDuration
    58â†’    }
    59â†’    
    60â†’    /// Calculate segment duration between two markers
    61â†’    /// - Parameters:
    62â†’    ///   - endMarkerTime: The time of the next marker
    63â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate for accurate calculation
    64â†’    /// - Returns: Duration of the segment
    65â†’    func segmentDuration(to endMarkerTime: CMTime, fps: Double) -> CMTime {
    66â†’        let adjustedEndTime = endMarkerTime.segmentEndTime(fps: fps)
    67â†’        return adjustedEndTime - self
    68â†’    }
    69â†’    
    70â†’    /// Check if this time represents a valid segment start
    71â†’    /// - Returns: true if the time is valid for segment extraction
    72â†’    var isValidSegmentTime: Bool {
    73â†’        return self != .invalid && 
    74â†’               self != .indefinite && 
    75â†’               self >= .zero &&
    76â†’               CMTimeGetSeconds(self).isFinite
    77â†’    }
    78â†’    
    79â†’    // MARK: - I-Frame Alignment
    80â†’    
    81â†’    /// Find the nearest I-frame time before this time
    82â†’    /// This is used for lossless extraction optimization
    83â†’    /// - Parameters:
    84â†’    ///   - iFrameTimes: Array of I-frame times in the video
    85â†’    /// - Returns: Nearest I-frame time before this time, or self if none found
    86â†’    func nearestPrecedingIFrame(from iFrameTimes: [CMTime]) -> CMTime {
    87â†’        let sortedTimes = iFrameTimes.sorted()
    88â†’        
    89â†’        // Binary search for the largest time <= self
    90â†’        var left = 0
    91â†’        var right = sortedTimes.count - 1
    92â†’        var result = self
    93â†’        
    94â†’        while left <= right {
    95â†’            let mid = (left + right) / 2
    96â†’            
    97â†’            if sortedTimes[mid] <= self {
    98â†’                result = sortedTimes[mid]
    99â†’                left = mid + 1
   100â†’            } else {
   101â†’                right = mid - 1
   102â†’            }
   103â†’        }
   104â†’        
   105â†’        return result
   106â†’    }
   107â†’    
   108â†’    /// Find the nearest I-frame time after this time
   109â†’    /// - Parameters:
   110â†’    ///   - iFrameTimes: Array of I-frame times in the video
   111â†’    /// - Returns: Nearest I-frame time after this time, or self if none found
   112â†’    func nearestSucceedingIFrame(from iFrameTimes: [CMTime]) -> CMTime {
   113â†’        let sortedTimes = iFrameTimes.sorted()
   114â†’        
   115â†’        // Binary search for the smallest time > self
   116â†’        var left = 0
   117â†’        var right = sortedTimes.count - 1
   118â†’        var result = self
   119â†’        
   120â†’        while left <= right {
   121â†’            let mid = (left + right) / 2
   122â†’            
   123â†’            if sortedTimes[mid] > self {
   124â†’                result = sortedTimes[mid]
   125â†’                right = mid - 1
   126â†’            } else {
   127â†’                left = mid + 1
   128â†’            }
   129â†’        }
   130â†’        
   131â†’        return result
   132â†’    }
   133â†’    
   134â†’    // MARK: - Formatting
   135â†’    
   136â†’    /// Format as a segment identifier (e.g., "01m23s456ms")
   137â†’    /// Used for generating unique segment filenames
   138â†’    var segmentIdentifier: String {
   139â†’        let seconds = CMTimeGetSeconds(self)
   140â†’        guard seconds.isFinite && seconds >= 0 else {
   141â†’            return "00m00s000ms"
   142â†’        }
   143â†’        
   144â†’        let totalMilliseconds = Int(seconds * 1000)
   145â†’        let minutes = totalMilliseconds / 60000
   146â†’        let secs = (totalMilliseconds % 60000) / 1000
   147â†’        let ms = totalMilliseconds % 1000
   148â†’        
   149â†’        return String(format: "%02dm%02ds%03dms", minutes, secs, ms)
   150â†’    }
   151â†’    
   152â†’    /// Format duration for display (e.g., "1:23.4")
   153â†’    var segmentDurationDisplay: String {
   154â†’        let seconds = CMTimeGetSeconds(self)
   155â†’        guard seconds.isFinite && seconds >= 0 else {
   156â†’            return "0:00.0"
   157â†’        }
   158â†’        
   159â†’        let mins = Int(seconds) / 60
   160â†’        let secs = seconds.truncatingRemainder(dividingBy: 60)
   161â†’        
   162â†’        if mins > 0 {
   163â†’            return String(format: "%d:%05.1f", mins, secs)
   164â†’        } else {
   165â†’            return String(format: "%.1f", secs)
   166â†’        }
   167â†’    }
   168â†’}

   173â†’

Branch: feature/segment-extraction

# Video Segment Extraction Implementation

Created: 2025-01-26
Status: active
Last updated: 2025-01-26
Type: feature

## Overview
Implement video segment extraction functionality using FFmpeg with stream copy for fast extraction. The feature will support single segment extraction, rating-based extraction, and manual selection of multiple segments. Later optimization will implement smart lossless extraction using I-frame analysis.

## Progress
- Overall: 8/24 tasks (33%)
- Phase 1: 7/7 tasks (complete)
- Phase 2: 1/5 tasks  
- Phase 3: 0/5 tasks
- Phase 4: 0/4 tasks
- Phase 5: 0/3 tasks

## Phase 1: Core FFmpeg Integration & Infrastructure

- [x] Install and configure FFmpeg dependency [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: Package.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add FFmpeg as dependency or document installation requirement

- [x] Create FFmpegManager class for video operations [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Implement Process wrapper for FFmpeg commands
  - Add stream copy extraction method

- [x] Implement segment time calculation utilities [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/CMTime+Segment.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Convert between CMTime and FFmpeg time format
  - Calculate frame-accurate end time (marker frame - 1)

- [x] Create SegmentExtractionManager [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift

content.text:
Implement tasks from a markdown plan file, automatically tracking progress and committing changes.

## Phase 1: Initialize

1. **Pre-flight Check**
   - Verify plan has been validated:
     - Check for Branch specification
     - Check for Metadata section
     - Verify checkbox presence
   - If missing required elements:
     ```
     ERROR: Plan document is not properly formatted.
     Please run: /user:validate-plan ${ARGUMENTS}
     ```

2. **Load Plan Context**
   - Read Branch specification
   - Parse Metadata (Created, Status, Type)
   - Check Status field:
     - If "completed": warn and confirm continuation
     - If "paused": show last completion date
     - If "active": proceed normally

3. **Branch Management**
   - Checkout specified branch (create if needed)
   - Verify we're on correct branch
   - Show git status

4. **Progress Overview**
   - Parse Progress section if present
   - Show current completion status:
     ```
     Plan: Authentication System Implementation
     Type: feature
     Branch: feature/implement-auth-system
     Progress: 3/15 tasks (20%)
     Last updated: 2024-01-14
     ```

## Phase 2: Parse Plan Structure

1. **Identify Task Format**
   - Find all checkbox items: `- [ ]` or `- [x]`
   - Detect hierarchy (nested lists, sections, phases)
   - Count total tasks vs completed tasks

2. **Extract Metadata**
   - Look for common patterns:
     - Time estimates: `[2h]`, `(30min)`, `~1 day`
     - Priority indicators: ðŸ”´ðŸŸ¡ðŸŸ¢âšª, HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW
     - File references: `file:`, `path:`, backticks
     - Task IDs: `#123`, `TASK-456`

3. **Build Task List**
   - Create ordered list of uncompleted tasks
   - Preserve context (section headers, parent tasks)
   - Note any explicit dependencies

## Phase 3: Task Selection

1. **Find Next Task**
   - Select first unchecked task in document order
   - Or respect priority if indicators present
   - Show task with full context:
   ```
   Next task from "Project Setup" section:
   
   - [ ] Configure database connection
     - Update config/database.yml
     - Set environment variables
     - Test connection
   
   Proceed? [Y/n/skip/browse]
   ```

2. **Browse Option**
   - Allow viewing all unchecked tasks
   - Let user select specific task
   - Support jumping to different sections

## Phase 4: Implementation

1. **Present Task Context**
   - Show the full task description
   - Display any subtasks or details
   - Highlight mentioned files or code

2. **Execute Implementation**
   - If files are mentioned, open and edit them
   - Allow user to describe what was done
   - Support multi-file changes

3. **Capture Changes**
   - Track all modified files
   - Show diff of changes
   - Confirm implementation is complete

## Phase 5: Update Plan

1. **Mark Task Complete**
   - Check the box: `- [ ]` â†’ `- [x]`
   - Add completion annotation:
     ```markdown
     - [x] Configure database connection âœ“ 2024-01-15
     ```

2. **Update Progress Section**
   - Locate Progress section
   - Update counters:
     ```markdown
     ## Progress
     - Overall: 4/15 tasks (27%)  â† was 3/15 (20%)
     - Setup: 2/3 tasks           â† if task was in Setup
     ```
   - Recalculate all percentages

3. **Update Metadata**
   - Update last modified date in metadata
   - If all tasks complete, update Status:
     ```markdown
     Status: completed  â† was active
     Completed: 2024-01-15
     ```

4. **Add Implementation Notes**
   - For significant changes, add to task:
     ```markdown
     - [x] Configure database connection âœ“ 2024-01-15
       > Note: Used PostgreSQL 14, added connection pooling
     ```

## Phase 6: Commit

1. **Prepare Commit**
   - Stage all changed files
   - Stage updated plan document
   - Generate commit message based on Type from metadata:
     - feature: `feat: <task description>`
     - bugfix: `fix: <task description>`
     - refactor: `refactor: <task description>`
     - migration: `chore: <task description>`

2. **Commit Format**
   ```bash
   git commit -m "<type>: <task description>

   - <summary of changes>
   - Update progress in <plan-file> (4/15 tasks)
   
   Plan: <plan-file>
   Branch: <branch-name>
   Progress: <new-percentage>%"
   ```

3. **Auto-pause Check**
   - If session has been long (>2 hours):
     ```
     You've completed 5 tasks in this session.
     Consider taking a break? [continue/pause]
     ```
   - If pause, update Status to "paused" with timestamp

## Phase 7: Continue

1. **Completion Check**
   - If all tasks complete:
     ```
     ðŸŽ‰ Plan completed!
     
     Summary:
     - Total tasks: 15
     - Time taken: 2 days
     - Branch: feature/implement-auth-system
     
     Next steps:
     1. Create pull request
     2. Archive plan (move to plans/completed/)
     3. Start new plan
     ```

2. **Continue Options**
   ```
   Task completed!
   Progress: 5/20 tasks (25%)
   Status: active
   Estimated remaining: ~12 hours
   
   1. Continue with next task
   2. Browse remaining tasks
   3. View updated plan
   4. Pause work (update status)
   5. End session
   
   Choice:
   ```

3. **Session Summary**
   - When ending, show:
     - Tasks completed this session
     - Progress delta (was 20%, now 35%)
     - Time estimates vs actual
     - Status update if paused

## Special Handlers

1. **Multi-Step Tasks**
   - If task has nested checkboxes, handle as subtasks
   - Only mark parent complete when all children done

2. **Code Blocks**
   - If task contains code blocks, offer to apply them
   - Support file creation from embedded code

3. **External References**
   - Handle URLs, issue numbers, PR references
   - Fetch context if needed

<rules>

- MUST verify plan has required elements (Branch, Metadata, Checkboxes)
- MUST refuse to proceed if plan not validated
- MUST use Branch specification from document
- MUST update Progress section after each task
- MUST update Metadata (last modified, status changes)
- MUST use Type field for commit message prefixes
- MUST handle Status field (active/paused/completed)
- MUST commit both implementation and plan updates together
- SHOULD track session duration for break reminders
- SHOULD calculate estimated remaining effort
- SHOULD auto-archive completed plans
- SHOULD show progress deltas in summaries
- MAY add implementation notes to tasks
- MAY skip tasks that are blocked
- MAY allow browsing and selecting specific tasks

</rules>

file.content:
Branch: feature/segment-extraction

# Video Segment Extraction Implementation

Created: 2025-01-26
Status: active
Last updated: 2025-01-26
Type: feature

## Overview
Implement video segment extraction functionality using FFmpeg with stream copy for fast extraction. The feature will support single segment extraction, rating-based extraction, and manual selection of multiple segments. Later optimization will implement smart lossless extraction using I-frame analysis.

## Progress
- Overall: 9/24 tasks (38%)
- Phase 1: 7/7 tasks (complete)
- Phase 2: 2/5 tasks  
- Phase 3: 0/5 tasks
- Phase 4: 0/4 tasks
- Phase 5: 0/3 tasks

## Phase 1: Core FFmpeg Integration & Infrastructure

- [x] Install and configure FFmpeg dependency [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: Package.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add FFmpeg as dependency or document installation requirement

- [x] Create FFmpegManager class for video operations [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Implement Process wrapper for FFmpeg commands
  - Add stream copy extraction method

- [x] Implement segment time calculation utilities [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/CMTime+Segment.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Convert between CMTime and FFmpeg time format
  - Calculate frame-accurate end time (marker frame - 1)

- [x] Create SegmentExtractionManager [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Single segment extraction using FFmpegManager
  - Progress tracking with Combine publishers

- [x] Implement extraction result models [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionResult.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success/failure states with error details
  - Output file path and metadata

- [x] Add file naming and output directory logic [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/ExtractionFileManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Generate unique filenames with segment info
  - Handle output directory selection

- [x] Create extraction error handling [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionError.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - FFmpeg error parsing
  - User-friendly error messages

## Phase 2: Extraction Modal UI

- [x] Create ExtractionModalView with tabs [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Use existing modal base design
  - Tab view for different extraction types
  - Default to single segment tab

- [x] Implement SingleSegmentExtractionView [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/SingleSegmentExtractionView.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Show current segment info (start/end times)
  - Extract button with loading state
  - Display segment duration and marker labels
  > Note: Implemented with background extraction support and system notifications

- [ ] Create extraction progress view [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionProgressView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Progress bar with percentage
  - Cancel button functionality
  - Time remaining estimate

- [ ] Add extraction completion feedback [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success message with file location
  - Open in Finder button
  - Error display for failures

- [ ] Implement keyboard shortcuts for extraction modal [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - ESC to close, Enter to extract
  - Tab navigation between extraction types

## Phase 3: Rating-Based & Multi-Select Extraction

- [ ] Create RatingBasedExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/RatingBasedExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Rating threshold picker (1-5 stars)
  - Preview of segments to extract
  - Batch extraction controls

- [ ] Implement MultiSelectExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/MultiSelectExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Segment list with checkboxes
  - Select all/none buttons
  - Show segment details (duration, rating)

- [ ] Add batch extraction support to SegmentExtractionManager [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Queue multiple extractions
  - Aggregate progress tracking
  - Cancellation of batch operations

- [ ] Create segment filtering logic [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/Array+Segment.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Filter by rating threshold
  - Get segments from marker pairs
  - Validate segment boundaries

- [ ] Implement batch result summary [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/BatchExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - Show success/failure count
  - List of extracted files
  - Total time and size saved

## Phase 4: Integration & Menu Items

- [ ] Add extraction menu items to main menu [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/App/SwiftMediaApp.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Extract Current Segment menu item
  - Extract Multiple Segments submenu
  - Keyboard shortcut assignments

- [ ] Connect VideoPlayerViewModel to extraction [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/ViewModels/VideoPlayerViewModel.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add extraction modal presentation
  - Pass current segment info
  - Handle extraction completion

- [ ] Add extraction state to ProjectManager [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Project/ProjectManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Track extraction history
  - Save output directory preference
  - Recent extractions list

- [ ] Implement extraction keyboard shortcuts [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Keyboard/ShortcutRegistry.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Add extraction shortcuts to registry
  - Default: Cmd+E for current segment
  - Make customizable

## Phase 5: Lossless Extraction Optimization

- [ ] Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Use ffprobe to find I-frame positions
  - Calculate optimal cut points
  - Return frame-accurate boundaries

- [ ] Create smart extraction with re-encoding [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SmartExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Stream copy between I-frames
  - Re-encode head/tail segments
  - Concatenate final output

- [ ] Add lossless option to UI [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionSettingsView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create smart extraction with re-encoding"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Toggle for lossless mode
  - Warning about longer processing
  - Quality comparison info

## Additional Metadata

### File Impact Analysis
**New files**: 
- Managers: FFmpegManager, SegmentExtractionManager, ExtractionFileManager, SmartExtractionManager
- Views: ExtractionModalView, SingleSegmentExtractionView, RatingBasedExtractionView, MultiSelectExtractionView, ExtractionProgressView, ExtractionResultView, BatchExtractionResultView, ExtractionSettingsView
- Models: ExtractionResult, ExtractionError
- Extensions: CMTime+Segment, Array+Segment

**Modified files**:
- Package.swift (FFmpeg dependency)
- SwiftMediaApp.swift (menu items)
- VideoPlayerViewModel.swift (extraction integration)
- ProjectManager.swift (extraction state)
- ShortcutRegistry.swift (shortcuts)

### Risk Assessment
**Technical risks**: 
- FFmpeg installation/bundling complexity
- Frame-accurate cutting edge cases
- Large file processing performance

**Timeline risks**: 
- I-frame detection complexity might take longer
- FFmpeg dependency management

**Integration risks**: 
- Ensuring frame accuracy with existing marker system
- Memory usage with large videos

### Success Criteria
- [ ] Single segment extraction works with frame accuracy
- [ ] Stream copy completes in <5 seconds for typical segments
- [ ] Rating-based extraction filters correctly
- [ ] Multi-select UI is intuitive and responsive
- [ ] Lossless extraction produces no visible artifacts
- [ ] All extraction types handle errors gracefully
- [ ] Progress feedback is accurate and cancellable

    12â†’/// Manages video segment extraction operations
    13â†’class SegmentExtractionManager: ObservableObject {
    14â†’    
    15â†’    // MARK: - Types
    16â†’    
    17â†’    enum ExtractionError: LocalizedError {
    18â†’        case invalidSegment
    19â†’        case noVideoPath
    20â†’        case outputDirectoryNotSet
    21â†’        case extractionFailed(String)

150â†’            }
   151â†’            return .success(outputPath)
   152â†’            
   153â†’        case .failure(let error):
   154â†’            task.status = .failed
   155â†’            task.error = error
   156â†’            await MainActor.run {
   157â†’                self.currentTask = nil
   158â†’                self.isExtracting = false
   159â†’                self.currentProgress = 0.0
   160â†’            }
   161â†’            return .failure(.extractionFailed(error.localizedDescription))
   162â†’        }
   163â†’    }
   164â†’    
   165â†’    /// Extract multiple segments in batch
   166â†’    /// - Parameters:
   167â†’    ///   - segments: Array of segments to extract
   168â†’    ///   - videoPath: Path to the source video
   169â†’    ///   - fps: Frame rate of the video
   170â†’    /// - Returns: Array of results for each extraction
   171â†’    @MainActor
   172â†’    func extractSegments(
   173â†’        _ segments: [Segment],
   174â†’        from videoPath: String,
   175â†’        fps: Double
   176â†’    ) async -> [(segment: Segment, result: Result<String, ExtractionError>)] {
   177â†’        
   178â†’        var results: [(Segment, Result<String, ExtractionError>)] = []
   179â†’        
   180â†’        // Create tasks for all segments
   181â†’        let tasks = segments.compactMap { segment -> ExtractionTask? in
   182â†’            guard let outputDir = outputDirectory else { return nil }
   183â†’            
   184â†’            let outputPath = generateOutputPath(
   185â†’                for: segment,
   186â†’                videoPath: videoPath,
   187â†’                outputDirectory: outputDir
   188â†’            )
   189â†’            
   190â†’            return ExtractionTask(segment: segment, outputPath: outputPath)
   191â†’        }
   192â†’        
   193â†’        extractionQueue = tasks
   194â†’        
   195â†’        // Process each segment
   196â†’        for (index, task) in tasks.enumerated() {
   197â†’            // Check for cancellation
   198â†’            if extractionWorkItem?.isCancelled == true {
   199â†’                let cancelResult = (task.segment, Result<String, ExtractionError>.failure(.cancelled))
   200â†’                results.append(cancelResult)
   201â†’                continue
   202â†’            }
   203â†’            
   204â†’            // Update progress
   205â†’            let overallProgress = Double(index) / Double(tasks.count) * 100
   206â†’            await MainActor.run {
   207â†’                self.currentProgress = overallProgress
   208â†’            }
   209â†’            
   210â†’            // Extract segment
   211â†’            let result = await extractSegment(task.segment, from: videoPath, fps: fps)
   212â†’            results.append((task.segment, result))
   213â†’        }
   214â†’        
   215â†’        // Clear queue
   216â†’        await MainActor.run {
   217â†’            self.extractionQueue.removeAll()
   218â†’            self.currentProgress = 100.0
   219â†’        }
   220â†’        
   221â†’        return results
   222â†’    }
   223â†’    
   224â†’    /// Cancel ongoing extraction
   225â†’    func cancelExtraction() {
   226â†’        ffmpegManager.cancelExtraction()
   227â†’        extractionWorkItem?.cancel()
   228â†’        
   229â†’        if var task = currentTask {
   230â†’            task.status = .cancelled
   231â†’            currentTask = task
   232â†’        }
   233â†’        
   234â†’        isExtracting = false
   235â†’        currentProgress = 0.0
   236â†’    }
   237â†’    
   238â†’    /// Set the output directory for extracted segments
   239â†’    func setOutputDirectory(_ url: URL) {
   240â†’        outputDirectory = url
   241â†’        saveOutputDirectory()
   242â†’    }
   243â†’    
   244â†’    /// Get segments filtered by minimum rating
   245â†’    func getSegmentsByRating(from segments: [Segment], minimumRating: Int) -> [Segment] {
   246â†’        segments.filter { segment in
   247â†’            segment.averageRating >= Double(minimumRating)
   248â†’        }
   249â†’    }

    12â†’/// Manages FFmpeg operations for video segment extraction

    57â†’    /// Check if FFmpeg is installed and available

    59â†’        let process = Process()
    60â†’        process.executableURL = URL(fileURLWithPath: "/usr/bin/env")
    61â†’        process.arguments = ["which", "ffmpeg"]
    62â†’        
    63â†’        let pipe = Pipe()
    64â†’        process.standardOutput = pipe

    68â†’            process.waitUntilExit()

   193â†’    /// Format time in seconds to HH:MM:SS.mmm format for FFmpeg
   194â†’    private func formatTime(_ seconds: Double) -> String {
   195â†’        let hours = Int(seconds) / 3600
   196â†’        let minutes = (Int(seconds) % 3600) / 60
   197â†’        let secs = seconds.truncatingRemainder(dividingBy: 60)
   198â†’        
   199â†’        return String(format: "%02d:%02d:%06.3f", hours, minutes, secs)
   200â†’    }
   201â†’    
   202â†’    /// Parse FFmpeg progress output
   203â†’    private func parseProgress(_ output: String, totalDuration: Double) {
   204â†’        // FFmpeg outputs progress like: "time=00:00:10.50"
   205â†’        if let timeMatch = output.range(of: #"time=(\d{2}):(\d{2}):(\d{2}\.\d+)"#, options: .regularExpression) {
   206â†’            let timeString = String(output[timeMatch])
   207â†’            let components = timeString.replacingOccurrences(of: "time=", with: "").split(separator: ":")
   208â†’            
   209â†’            if components.count == 3,
   210â†’               let hours = Double(components[0]),
   211â†’               let minutes = Double(components[1]),
   212â†’               let seconds = Double(components[2]) {
   213â†’                
   214â†’                let currentTime = hours * 3600 + minutes * 60 + seconds
   215â†’                let percentage = min(currentTime / totalDuration, 1.0) * 100
   216â†’                
   217â†’                let remainingTime = totalDuration - currentTime
   218â†’                let estimatedTimeRemaining = remainingTime > 0 ? remainingTime : nil
   219â†’                
   220â†’                let progress = ExtractionProgress(
   221â†’                    percentage: percentage,
   222â†’                    currentTime: currentTime,
   223â†’                    totalTime: totalDuration,
   224â†’                    estimatedTimeRemaining: estimatedTimeRemaining
   225â†’                )
   226â†’                
   227â†’                DispatchQueue.main.async { [weak self] in
   228â†’                    self?.progressSubject.send(progress)
   229â†’                }
   230â†’            }
   231â†’        }
   232â†’    }

Branch: feature/segment-extraction

# Video Segment Extraction Implementation

Created: 2025-01-26
Status: active
Last updated: 2025-01-26
Type: feature

## Overview
Implement video segment extraction functionality using FFmpeg with stream copy for fast extraction. The feature will support single segment extraction, rating-based extraction, and manual selection of multiple segments. Later optimization will implement smart lossless extraction using I-frame analysis.

## Progress
- Overall: 9/24 tasks (38%)
- Phase 1: 7/7 tasks (complete)
- Phase 2: 2/5 tasks  
- Phase 3: 0/5 tasks
- Phase 4: 0/4 tasks
- Phase 5: 0/3 tasks

## Phase 1: Core FFmpeg Integration & Infrastructure

- [x] Install and configure FFmpeg dependency [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: Package.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add FFmpeg as dependency or document installation requirement

- [x] Create FFmpegManager class for video operations [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Implement Process wrapper for FFmpeg commands
  - Add stream copy extraction method

- [x] Implement segment time calculation utilities [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/CMTime+Segment.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Convert between CMTime and FFmpeg time format
  - Calculate frame-accurate end time (marker frame - 1)

- [x] Create SegmentExtractionManager [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Single segment extraction using FFmpegManager
  - Progress tracking with Combine publishers

- [x] Implement extraction result models [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionResult.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success/failure states with error details
  - Output file path and metadata

- [x] Add file naming and output directory logic [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/ExtractionFileManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Generate unique filenames with segment info
  - Handle output directory selection

- [x] Create extraction error handling [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionError.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - FFmpeg error parsing
  - User-friendly error messages

## Phase 2: Extraction Modal UI

- [x] Create ExtractionModalView with tabs [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Use existing modal base design
  - Tab view for different extraction types
  - Default to single segment tab

- [x] Implement SingleSegmentExtractionView [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/SingleSegmentExtractionView.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Show current segment info (start/end times)
  - Extract button with loading state
  - Display segment duration and marker labels
  > Note: Implemented with background extraction support and system notifications

- [ ] Create extraction progress view [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionProgressView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Progress bar with percentage
  - Cancel button functionality
  - Time remaining estimate

- [ ] Add extraction completion feedback [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success message with file location
  - Open in Finder button
  - Error display for failures

- [ ] Implement keyboard shortcuts for extraction modal [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - ESC to close, Enter to extract
  - Tab navigation between extraction types

## Phase 3: Rating-Based & Multi-Select Extraction

- [ ] Create RatingBasedExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/RatingBasedExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Rating threshold picker (1-5 stars)
  - Preview of segments to extract
  - Batch extraction controls

- [ ] Implement MultiSelectExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/MultiSelectExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Segment list with checkboxes
  - Select all/none buttons
  - Show segment details (duration, rating)

- [ ] Add batch extraction support to SegmentExtractionManager [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Queue multiple extractions
  - Aggregate progress tracking
  - Cancellation of batch operations

- [ ] Create segment filtering logic [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/Array+Segment.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Filter by rating threshold
  - Get segments from marker pairs
  - Validate segment boundaries

- [ ] Implement batch result summary [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/BatchExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - Show success/failure count
  - List of extracted files
  - Total time and size saved

## Phase 4: Integration & Menu Items

- [ ] Add extraction menu items to main menu [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/App/SwiftMediaApp.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Extract Current Segment menu item
  - Extract Multiple Segments submenu
  - Keyboard shortcut assignments

- [ ] Connect VideoPlayerViewModel to extraction [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/ViewModels/VideoPlayerViewModel.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add extraction modal presentation
  - Pass current segment info
  - Handle extraction completion

- [ ] Add extraction state to ProjectManager [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Project/ProjectManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Track extraction history
  - Save output directory preference
  - Recent extractions list

- [ ] Implement extraction keyboard shortcuts [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Keyboard/ShortcutRegistry.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Add extraction shortcuts to registry
  - Default: Cmd+E for current segment
  - Make customizable

## Phase 5: Lossless Extraction Optimization

- [ ] Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Use ffprobe to find I-frame positions
  - Calculate optimal cut points
  - Return frame-accurate boundaries

- [ ] Create smart extraction with re-encoding [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SmartExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Stream copy between I-frames
  - Re-encode head/tail segments
  - Concatenate final output

- [ ] Add lossless option to UI [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionSettingsView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create smart extraction with re-encoding"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Toggle for lossless mode
  - Warning about longer processing
  - Quality comparison info

## Additional Metadata

### File Impact Analysis
**New files**: 
- Managers: FFmpegManager, SegmentExtractionManager, ExtractionFileManager, SmartExtractionManager
- Views: ExtractionModalView, SingleSegmentExtractionView, RatingBasedExtractionView, MultiSelectExtractionView, ExtractionProgressView, ExtractionResultView, BatchExtractionResultView, ExtractionSettingsView
- Models: ExtractionResult, ExtractionError
- Extensions: CMTime+Segment, Array+Segment

**Modified files**:
- Package.swift (FFmpeg dependency)
- SwiftMediaApp.swift (menu items)
- VideoPlayerViewModel.swift (extraction integration)
- ProjectManager.swift (extraction state)
- ShortcutRegistry.swift (shortcuts)

### Risk Assessment
**Technical risks**: 
- FFmpeg installation/bundling complexity
- Frame-accurate cutting edge cases
- Large file processing performance

**Timeline risks**: 
- I-frame detection complexity might take longer
- FFmpeg dependency management

**Integration risks**: 
- Ensuring frame accuracy with existing marker system
- Memory usage with large videos

### Success Criteria
- [ ] Single segment extraction works with frame accuracy
- [ ] Stream copy completes in <5 seconds for typical segments
- [ ] Rating-based extraction filters correctly
- [ ] Multi-select UI is intuitive and responsive
- [ ] Lossless extraction produces no visible artifacts
- [ ] All extraction types handle errors gracefully
- [ ] Progress feedback is accurate and cancellable

> Note: Implemented with background extraction support and system notifications

content.text:
Implement tasks from a markdown plan file, automatically tracking progress and committing changes.

## Phase 1: Initialize

1. **Pre-flight Check**
   - Verify plan has been validated:
     - Check for Branch specification
     - Check for Metadata section
     - Verify checkbox presence
   - If missing required elements:
     ```
     ERROR: Plan document is not properly formatted.
     Please run: /user:validate-plan ${ARGUMENTS}
     ```

2. **Load Plan Context**
   - Read Branch specification
   - Parse Metadata (Created, Status, Type)
   - Check Status field:
     - If "completed": warn and confirm continuation
     - If "paused": show last completion date
     - If "active": proceed normally

3. **Branch Management**
   - Checkout specified branch (create if needed)
   - Verify we're on correct branch
   - Show git status

4. **Progress Overview**
   - Parse Progress section if present
   - Show current completion status:
     ```
     Plan: Authentication System Implementation
     Type: feature
     Branch: feature/implement-auth-system
     Progress: 3/15 tasks (20%)
     Last updated: 2024-01-14
     ```

## Phase 2: Parse Plan Structure

1. **Identify Task Format**
   - Find all checkbox items: `- [ ]` or `- [x]`
   - Detect hierarchy (nested lists, sections, phases)
   - Count total tasks vs completed tasks

2. **Extract Metadata**
   - Look for common patterns:
     - Time estimates: `[2h]`, `(30min)`, `~1 day`
     - Priority indicators: ðŸ”´ðŸŸ¡ðŸŸ¢âšª, HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW
     - File references: `file:`, `path:`, backticks
     - Task IDs: `#123`, `TASK-456`

3. **Build Task List**
   - Create ordered list of uncompleted tasks
   - Preserve context (section headers, parent tasks)
   - Note any explicit dependencies

## Phase 3: Task Selection

1. **Find Next Task**
   - Select first unchecked task in document order
   - Or respect priority if indicators present
   - Show task with full context:
   ```
   Next task from "Project Setup" section:
   
   - [ ] Configure database connection
     - Update config/database.yml
     - Set environment variables
     - Test connection
   
   Proceed? [Y/n/skip/browse]
   ```

2. **Browse Option**
   - Allow viewing all unchecked tasks
   - Let user select specific task
   - Support jumping to different sections

## Phase 4: Implementation

1. **Present Task Context**
   - Show the full task description
   - Display any subtasks or details
   - Highlight mentioned files or code

2. **Execute Implementation**
   - If files are mentioned, open and edit them
   - Allow user to describe what was done
   - Support multi-file changes

3. **Capture Changes**
   - Track all modified files
   - Show diff of changes
   - Confirm implementation is complete

## Phase 5: Update Plan

1. **Mark Task Complete**
   - Check the box: `- [ ]` â†’ `- [x]`
   - Add completion annotation:
     ```markdown
     - [x] Configure database connection âœ“ 2024-01-15
     ```

2. **Update Progress Section**
   - Locate Progress section
   - Update counters:
     ```markdown
     ## Progress
     - Overall: 4/15 tasks (27%)  â† was 3/15 (20%)
     - Setup: 2/3 tasks           â† if task was in Setup
     ```
   - Recalculate all percentages

3. **Update Metadata**
   - Update last modified date in metadata
   - If all tasks complete, update Status:
     ```markdown
     Status: completed  â† was active
     Completed: 2024-01-15
     ```

4. **Add Implementation Notes**
   - For significant changes, add to task:
     ```markdown
     - [x] Configure database connection âœ“ 2024-01-15
       > Note: Used PostgreSQL 14, added connection pooling
     ```

## Phase 6: Commit

1. **Prepare Commit**
   - Stage all changed files
   - Stage updated plan document
   - Generate commit message based on Type from metadata:
     - feature: `feat: <task description>`
     - bugfix: `fix: <task description>`
     - refactor: `refactor: <task description>`
     - migration: `chore: <task description>`

2. **Commit Format**
   ```bash
   git commit -m "<type>: <task description>

   - <summary of changes>
   - Update progress in <plan-file> (4/15 tasks)
   
   Plan: <plan-file>
   Branch: <branch-name>
   Progress: <new-percentage>%"
   ```

3. **Auto-pause Check**
   - If session has been long (>2 hours):
     ```
     You've completed 5 tasks in this session.
     Consider taking a break? [continue/pause]
     ```
   - If pause, update Status to "paused" with timestamp

## Phase 7: Continue

1. **Completion Check**
   - If all tasks complete:
     ```
     ðŸŽ‰ Plan completed!
     
     Summary:
     - Total tasks: 15
     - Time taken: 2 days
     - Branch: feature/implement-auth-system
     
     Next steps:
     1. Create pull request
     2. Archive plan (move to plans/completed/)
     3. Start new plan
     ```

2. **Continue Options**
   ```
   Task completed!
   Progress: 5/20 tasks (25%)
   Status: active
   Estimated remaining: ~12 hours
   
   1. Continue with next task
   2. Browse remaining tasks
   3. View updated plan
   4. Pause work (update status)
   5. End session
   
   Choice:
   ```

3. **Session Summary**
   - When ending, show:
     - Tasks completed this session

Branch: feature/segment-extraction

# Video Segment Extraction Implementation

Created: 2025-01-26
Status: active
Last updated: 2025-01-26
Type: feature

## Overview
Implement video segment extraction functionality using FFmpeg with stream copy for fast extraction. The feature will support single segment extraction, rating-based extraction, and manual selection of multiple segments. Later optimization will implement smart lossless extraction using I-frame analysis.

## Progress
- Overall: 12/24 tasks (50%)
- Phase 1: 7/7 tasks (complete)
- Phase 2: 5/5 tasks (complete)  
- Phase 3: 0/5 tasks
- Phase 4: 0/4 tasks
- Phase 5: 0/3 tasks

## Phase 1: Core FFmpeg Integration & Infrastructure

- [x] Install and configure FFmpeg dependency [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: Package.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add FFmpeg as dependency or document installation requirement

- [x] Create FFmpegManager class for video operations [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Implement Process wrapper for FFmpeg commands
  - Add stream copy extraction method

- [x] Implement segment time calculation utilities [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/CMTime+Segment.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Convert between CMTime and FFmpeg time format
  - Calculate frame-accurate end time (marker frame - 1)

- [x] Create SegmentExtractionManager [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Single segment extraction using FFmpegManager
  - Progress tracking with Combine publishers

- [x] Implement extraction result models [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionResult.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success/failure states with error details
  - Output file path and metadata

- [x] Add file naming and output directory logic [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/ExtractionFileManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Generate unique filenames with segment info
  - Handle output directory selection

- [x] Create extraction error handling [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Models/ExtractionError.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - FFmpeg error parsing
  - User-friendly error messages

## Phase 2: Extraction Modal UI

- [x] Create ExtractionModalView with tabs [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: HIGH
  - Use existing modal base design
  - Tab view for different extraction types
  - Default to single segment tab

- [x] Implement SingleSegmentExtractionView [2h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/SingleSegmentExtractionView.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Show current segment info (start/end times)
  - Extract button with loading state
  - Display segment duration and marker labels
  > Note: Implemented with background extraction support and system notifications

- [x] Create extraction progress view [1h] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionProgressView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Progress bar with percentage
  - Cancel button functionality
  - Time remaining estimate

- [x] Add extraction completion feedback [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Success message with file location
  - Open in Finder button
  - Error display for failures

- [x] Implement keyboard shortcuts for extraction modal [30min] âœ“ 2025-01-26
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionModalView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - ESC to close, Enter to extract
  - Tab navigation between extraction types

## Phase 3: Rating-Based & Multi-Select Extraction

- [ ] Create RatingBasedExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/RatingBasedExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Rating threshold picker (1-5 stars)
  - Preview of segments to extract
  - Batch extraction controls

- [ ] Implement MultiSelectExtractionView [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/MultiSelectExtractionView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create ExtractionModalView with tabs"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Segment list with checkboxes
  - Select all/none buttons
  - Show segment details (duration, rating)

- [ ] Add batch extraction support to SegmentExtractionManager [2h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SegmentExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create SegmentExtractionManager"]
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Queue multiple extractions
  - Aggregate progress tracking
  - Cancellation of batch operations

- [ ] Create segment filtering logic [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Extensions/Array+Segment.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Filter by rating threshold
  - Get segments from marker pairs
  - Validate segment boundaries

- [ ] Implement batch result summary [30min]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/BatchExtractionResultView.swift
  - priority: LOW
  - Show success/failure count
  - List of extracted files
  - Total time and size saved

## Phase 4: Integration & Menu Items

- [ ] Add extraction menu items to main menu [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/App/SwiftMediaApp.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Extract Current Segment menu item
  - Extract Multiple Segments submenu
  - Keyboard shortcut assignments

- [ ] Connect VideoPlayerViewModel to extraction [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/ViewModels/VideoPlayerViewModel.swift
  - priority: HIGH
  - Add extraction modal presentation
  - Pass current segment info
  - Handle extraction completion

- [ ] Add extraction state to ProjectManager [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Project/ProjectManager.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Track extraction history
  - Save output directory preference
  - Recent extractions list

- [ ] Implement extraction keyboard shortcuts [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Keyboard/ShortcutRegistry.swift
  - priority: MEDIUM
  - Add extraction shortcuts to registry
  - Default: Cmd+E for current segment
  - Make customizable

## Phase 5: Lossless Extraction Optimization

- [ ] Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/FFmpegManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create FFmpegManager class for video operations"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Use ffprobe to find I-frame positions
  - Calculate optimal cut points
  - Return frame-accurate boundaries

- [ ] Create smart extraction with re-encoding [4h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Managers/Video/SmartExtractionManager.swift
  - depends_on: ["Implement I-frame detection in FFmpegManager"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Stream copy between I-frames
  - Re-encode head/tail segments
  - Concatenate final output

- [ ] Add lossless option to UI [1h]
  - file: SwiftMedia/Views/Extraction/ExtractionSettingsView.swift
  - depends_on: ["Create smart extraction with re-encoding"]
  - priority: LOW
  - Toggle for lossless mode
  - Warning about longer processing
  - Quality comparison info

## Additional Metadata

### File Impact Analysis
**New files**: 
- Managers: FFmpegManager, SegmentExtractionManager, ExtractionFileManager, SmartExtractionManager
- Views: ExtractionModalView, SingleSegmentExtractionView, RatingBasedExtractionView, MultiSelectExtractionView, ExtractionProgressView, ExtractionResultView, BatchExtractionResultView, ExtractionSettingsView
- Models: ExtractionResult, ExtractionError
- Extensions: CMTime+Segment, Array+Segment

**Modified files**:
- Package.swift (FFmpeg dependency)
- SwiftMediaApp.swift (menu items)
- VideoPlayerViewModel.swift (extraction integration)
- ProjectManager.swift (extraction state)
- ShortcutRegistry.swift (shortcuts)

### Risk Assessment
**Technical risks**: 
- FFmpeg installation/bundling complexity
- Frame-accurate cutting edge cases
- Large file processing performance

**Timeline risks**: 
- I-frame detection complexity might take longer
- FFmpeg dependency management

**Integration risks**: 
- Ensuring frame accuracy with existing marker system
- Memory usage with large videos

### Success Criteria
- [ ] Single segment extraction works with frame accuracy
- [ ] Stream copy completes in <5 seconds for typical segments
- [ ] Rating-based extraction filters correctly
- [ ] Multi-select UI is intuitive and responsive
- [ ] Lossless extraction produces no visible artifacts
- [ ] All extraction types handle errors gracefully
- [ ] Progress feedback is accurate and cancellable
